com.aurel.track.prop

Class BanProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aurel.track.prop.BanProcessor

  • public class BanProcessor
extends java.lang.Object

    Bans clients when they repeatedly fail to authenticate themselves. BanProcessor is a singleton.

    This does not work well if clients are hidden behind proxies, because the application sees only the proxy IP and bans all clients that hide behind that proxy. In that case we have to reduce the ban time in file in WEB-INF/quartz-jobs.xml.

      • markBadAttempt

        public void markBadAttempt(java.lang.String ipNumber)
        If there was a bad attempt, call this function to mark it.
        Parameters:

      • removeBanEntry

        public void removeBanEntry(java.lang.String ipNumber)
        If there was a good attempt, you can remove the ban with this function.
        Parameters:
        ipNumber - the IP number of the client with the bad attempt.

      • isBanned

        public boolean isBanned(java.lang.String ipNumber)
        Check if this client is banned. If there have been repeated attempts to break in the client is banned for the BANTIME.
        Parameters:
        ipNumber - the IP number of the client to be checked for.
        Returns:

      • updateBanMap

        public void updateBanMap()
        This needs to be regularly called (by a job) to reset old bans. Otherwise clients would be permanently banned until the next server restart.
